title: Charge Master Manager - Revenue Cycle #58
description:
**Who We Are:**


St. John’s Episcopal Hospital is the only hospital providing emergency and ambulatory care to the densely populated, culturally and economically diverse, and medically underserved populations of the Rockaways and Five Towns in southern Queens County and southwestern Nassau County, New York. Celebrating over 110 years of community care, the 257-bed facility provides people of all faiths with comprehensive preventive, diagnostic treatment and rehabilitative services, regardless of ability to pay.


***Come Grow With Us!***


**Type:** Full-Time


**Shift:** Days


**Hours:** 8:00AM – 4:30PM


**Pay:** $89,250 - $105,000


**Job Summary:**


The Charge Master Manager is responsible for the formulation and maintenance of the Charge Description Master in order to optimize revenue generation and maintain compliance with third party requirements and Price Transparency regulations. The incumbent supports clinical areas throughout the hospital in charge identification. Duties include serving as a contributing member of the Revenue Cycle team; maintaining Charge Description and Room & Bed master profiles; working with revenue generating departments and Information Technology to ensure ongoing coordination of the Charge Master compared to the Service Master and Room & Bed Master; ensuring accurate descriptions, CPT/HCPCS coding, additions, deletions, pricing, and any other changes are accounted for and included; maintaining a working knowledge of revenue cycle processes to aid in the implementation of regulatory standards that assist the health system in cash collection and compliance with billing guidelines; maintaining and ensuring timely turnaround of all Charger Master Requests according to hospital policies and procedures; monitoring facility charging mechanisms and systems to ensure correct processing for accurate billing; participating in activities that promote adherence to federal healthcare program requirements; adhering to the requirements of HIPAA Privacy Policies and Procedures; performing other duties as assigned.


**Responsibilities:**


* Evaluate the impact of innovations and changes in programs, policies, and procedures relative to the capture of charges for services rendered and related coding, classification, and pricing
* Design and implement systems and methods to improve charge integrity and charge capture compliance
* Identify, assess, and resolve issues impacting the charge capture, documentation, and related revenue cycle processes while providing guidance to charge capture workflows
* Keep the Charge Description Master (CDM) current and accurate with regard to changes requested by clinical and ancillary departments and pricing updates
* Make timely updates to the CDM when new regulations are published and coordinate their implementation with changes to the responsible department managers
* Assist and guide resolution of NCCI, OCE, and MUE Billing Edits; requiring in depth knowledge of revenue codes, CPT/HCPCS Level II codes, billing and coding edits, and billing reimbursement practices
* Manage upgrades, user troubleshooting, and perform administrative responsibilities for the facility setup and maintenance for CDM/charging/pricing software programs
* Educate departments and providers with respect to the use and maintenance of the charge master and charging philosophy
* Oversee, coordinate, and maintain Price Transparency requirements for the health system
* Oversee, coordinate, and maintain the Financial Assistance Program policies and procedures
* Audit system reports to address charging issues
* Develop and maintain documentation on charge master data management, pricing, and price transparency processes and procedures


**Requirements:**


* Associate's Degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or related field required; Bachelor's Degree preferred
* Certified Coding Specialist (CCS) or Certified Professional Coder (CPC) certification required
* Experience with coding systems such as ICD-10-CM/PCS, CPT-4, HCPCS Level II, and/or Medical Billing Codes
* Experience with billing and claims management systems in a hospital setting, Meditech preferred
* Knowledge of Medical Terminology, Anatomy, and Physiology
* 2-3 years experience in a healthcare or medical billing setting, charge master data experience preferred
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and Google Suite (Google Sheets, Google Docs)
* Familiarity with healthcare industry regulations governing privacy, billing and reimbursement, pricing, and price transparency
* Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills

title: Maintenance Worker (Monday -Friday 8:00am - 4:00pm)
description:
**Are you passionate about making a difference in others' lives? Then come join the Straight and Narrow team!**


**Headquartered in Paterson, NJ, Straight and Narrow is the largest program of its kind. We provide innovative and compassionate services to individuals struggling with substance use and co-occurring disorders. We are looking for dedicated, caring and compassionate people to work in our Residential/Outpatient Treatment Facilities and Community Programs.**


Maintenance Worker


Schedule per week**:** 40 hours (Monday -Friday 8:00am - 4:00pm)


Location**:** Paterson, NJ


***Job Specific Responsibilities and Duties:***


Perform all maintenance tasks as assigned by the Director of Operations or Maintenance Supervisor which include:


* Perform service and repairs in the areas of plumbing, carpentry, painting, plastering, electrical and general building maintenance such as:


* Repairing toilet flush systems, installing seats, installing toilet bowls, installing toilet room wall fixtures.


* Installing faucets, faucet washers, cleaning sink drains, toilet drains and related tasks.


* Repairing holes in sheetrock and plaster walls, spackling and painting same.


* Making minor electrical repairs, light switches, replacing bulbs and fixtures, etc.


* Operating the air-conditioning and/or heating system(s).


* Replacing air conditioning and heating/ventilation filters and cleaning overhead air grilles on a regular basis.


* Repairing doorknobs, latches, locks and responsible for the keys. Responsible for the building’s security system (if any).


* May serve as the point person in case of an emergency at the location which includes the following responsibilities:


* Must be well versed with the operations and functions of the alarm system at his/her site.


* Be fully familiar with fire and emergency exit plans and plans for alternative service provision.


* under the direction/supervision of Facilities Maintenance I.


* May be responsible for the Health and Safety Facility Logs (a/k/a Blue Books) including testing the alarms systems and for conducting fire and emergency drills under the direction/supervision of Facilities Maintenance I.


* Responsible for preventive maintenance and for the general upkeep of the facility’s H.V.A.C systems, toilet facilities, flooring, landscaping, and trash removal systems.



***Qualifications:***


Minimum of High School Diploma with good interpersonal skills and relevant work experience required. Must be able to work over-time (nights & weekends). Might be required to work during inclement weather conditions and other agency closings. Valid Driver's License.


***Benefits:***


For full time positions, we offer medical, vision, dental, life and supplemental life insurance. Accidental and Critical Illness Insurance, 403B with employer match, Paid Time off (PTO), in house training seminars, two training days for certified professionals. SN also offers supervision for those individuals trying to become licensed in NJ as a LCADC/CADC, LSW, LCSW, LAC, LPC and LMFT. We participate in employee discount programs such as the Working Advantage program.

title: Residential Life Supervisor Women's Treatment (Tuesday- Saturday 8:00am-4:00pm)
description:
Are you passionate about making a difference in others' lives? Then come join the Straight and Narrow team!


Headquartered in Paterson, NJ, Straight and Narrow is the largest program of its kind. We provide innovative and compassionate services to individuals struggling with substance use and co-occurring disorders. We are looking for dedicated, caring and compassionate people to work in our Residential/Outpatient Treatment Facilities and Community Programs.


**Residential Life Supervisor**


Schedule per week: Tuesday- Saturday 8:00am-4:00pm


Location: Travel to Paterson and Secaucus Locations


**Job Summary:**


Supervise Residential Life staff and client outside appointments. Ensure a clean and orderly physical plant and take a leadership role in maintaining a safe, disciplined and caring environment on the unit. Be available on-call 24/7 in the absence of Senior Residential Life Director.


**Position Specific Duties and Responsibilities:**


Maintain a safe, disciplined and caring environment on the unit and wherever the unit’s clients and children travel within or outside the agency.


* + Assume responsibilities of Residential Life Director in his/her absence from the agency in coordination with program director and/or designee

	+ Have a thorough knowledge of CC-Straight & Narrow’s Policies & Procedures and Clients’ Handbook and enforce the rules and structures contained therein.

	+ Assist in scheduling all Residential Life (RL) Associates and ensure there is adequate coverage on all shifts.

	+ Assign on-going and specific tasks to RL Associates, filling in, when necessary, to ensure their completion.

	+ Oversee Petty Cash as assigned.

	+ Provide client interventions as needed

	+ Attend client interventions, case conferences and Multidisciplinary Meetings (MDT), Team Morning Meetings in the absence of the RL Director.

	+ Appoint Room Representative as needed for new clients.

	+ Assign clients’ rooms, ensure rooms are labeled appropriately.

	+ Oversee Jobsite roster on every client.

	+ Schedule clients for sick call when assigned

	+ Schedule clients’ outside appointments (OSA’s) and coordinate with transportation or provide transportation by unit for approved OSA’s; assign staff or resident to escort each OSA, when assigned

	+ Ensure that daily client count sheet is prepared and completed by RL staff.

	+ Schedule and supervise clients’ daily housekeeping tasks (General Inspections) during assigned shifts.

	+ Monitor and order all household supplies for the unit and urine analysis supplies

	+ Notify kitchen in advance of all activities that require changing a meal time or reduce the number of meals required.

	+ Ensure that new clients are greeted and oriented appropriately by RL Associate staff.

	+ Keep a current log of clients on Behavioral Change Agreements (BCA)

	+ Collect clients’ urines and administer breathalyzer test in accordance with Policy & Procedure on an as needed basis.

	+ Follow all Electronic Health Records (EHR) policies.

	+ Document and Process all Special Request for clients on the units and ensure the Clinical Care Managers receive these Special Request Forms

	+ Maintain and File all documents regarding special dietary needs

	+ Ensure clients honor the scheduled appointments with Medical, nutritionist, etc.
**Qualifications:**


Associates Degree with 3 years’ relevant experience or Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of two-year experience working in the field of addiction treatment. Two years’ supervisory experience required. Have CPR certification or achieve CPR certification within thirty days from the date of hire. Behavioral Assistance Certification preferred, especially for adolescent treatment unit. Must have a valid driver’s license from the state of residence and a clear driving record. Travel to Secaucus and Paterson


**Benefits:**


For full time positions, we offer medical, vision, dental, life and supplemental life insurance. Accidental and Critical Illness Insurance, 403B with employer match, Paid Time off (PTO), in house training seminars, two training days for certified professionals. SN also offers supervision for those individuals trying to become licensed in NJ as a LCADC/CADC, LSW, LCSW, LAC, LPC and LMFT. We participate in employee discount programs such as the Working Advantage program.

title: CADC/LCADC Counselor HWH (Tuesday-Saturday 11:00am-7:00pm)
description:
**Are you passionate about making a difference in others' lives? Then come join the Straight and Narrow team!**


**Headquartered in Paterson, NJ, Straight and Narrow is the largest program of its kind. We provide innovative and compassionate services to individuals struggling with substance use and co-occurring disorders. We are looking for dedicated, caring and compassionate people to work in our Residential/Outpatient Treatment Facilities and Community Programs.**


**CADC/LCADC Counselor (HWH)**


Schedule per week: Full Time (Tuesday- Saturday 11:00am-7:00pm)


Location: Passaic, NJ


**Sign on bonus of $3000 (Full Time Only) (New Employees Only)**


***Job Summary:***


The Credentialed Counselor functions an integral part of the treatment team and provides individual, group, family and didactic sessions as well as case management services to the clients on his/her caseload ensuring that the treatment requirements of all regulating bodies are fulfilled.


***Responsibilities:***


1. Provide individual, group and family counseling; didactics; treatment planning and case management as required per licensing standards (residential or ambulatory according to program) for a caseload of clients


2. Formulate measurable individualized Treatment Plans and Treatment Plan Reviews for each client on caseload


3. Maintain clinical portion of clients’ charts as per the Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services (DMHAS) and CARF guidelines, ensuring that all documentation is up to date as per Straight & Narrow’s Policy on Timeframe for Documentation in Clients’ Charts


4. Attend regularly scheduled multidisciplinary team meetings (MDT) and present information for Treatment Plan or Treatment Plan Review for clients on caseload


5. Attend individual and group supervision with Clinical Supervisor as scheduled


6. Provide clients on caseload with referrals to other agencies (i.e., health, psychiatric, vocational rehabilitation and public assistance) for concurrent and/or continued care as part of case management as necessary


7. Provide crisis intervention to clients as necessary


8. Submit documentation to Supervisor daily for any/all sessions held with clients on that day


9. Attend and actively participate in all CQI subcommittee meetings and/or Grievance Committee meetings on which membership is held


10. Prepare monthly reports to overseeing agencies/referral sources (i.e., DCP&P Drug Court, probation officers, parole officers)


11. Present supervisor annually documentation of continuing education coursework to maintain CADC/LCADC certification.


12. Encourage and support clients’ participation in AA/NA/GA activities


13. Encourage and support clients’ participation in AA/NA


14. Follow all Electronic Health Records (EHR) policies.


***Benefits:***


For full time positions, we offer medical, vision, dental, life and supplemental life insurance. Accidental and Critical Illness Insurance, 403B with employer match, Paid Time off (PTO), in house training seminars, two training days for certified professionals. SN also offers supervision for those individuals trying to become licensed in NJ as a LCADC/CADC, LSW, LCSW, LAC, LPC and LMFT. We participate in employee discount programs such as the Working Advantage program.


***Qualifications:***


Must have a BA/BS or MA/MSW degree with a CADC or LCADC. 1-3 years' experience in the addictions and/or mental health field. Good interpersonal, verbal and written skills. Familiar with NJSAMS, ASAM and LOCI. Experience facilitating group and individuals and familiar with Drug Court Policies. Excellent working knowledge of computers. Experience in the fee per service environment a plus.

title: Residential Shift Leader Sunday- Thursday 4:00pm-12:00am (Women's Residential)
description:
**Are you passionate about making a difference in others' lives? Then come join the Straight and Narrow team!**


**Headquartered in Paterson, NJ, Straight and Narrow is the largest program of its kind. We provide innovative and compassionate services to individuals struggling with substance use and co-occurring disorders. We are looking for dedicated, caring and compassionate people to work in our Residential/Outpatient Treatment Facilities and Community Programs.**


Residential Life-Shift Leader


Schedule per week: 40 hours (Sunday- Thursday 4:00pm-12:00am)


Location: Paterson, NJ


Job Summary:


Ensure a clean and orderly physical plant and take a leadership role in maintaining a safe, disciplined and caring environment on the unit.


Position Specific Duties and Responsibilities:


1. Participate in the employee hiring and employee termination process and/or recommend disciplinary action when appropriate.


2. Maintain a safe, disciplined and caring environment on the unit and wherever the unit’s clients travel within or outside the agency.


3. Assume responsibilities of Residential Life Supervisor in his/her absence from the agency.


4. Have a thorough knowledge of Straight & Narrow’s Policies & Procedures and Clients’ Handbook and enforce the rules and structures contained therein.


5. Provide guidance to and assign specific tasks to RL Associates on the shift, filling in, when necessary, to ensure their completion.


6. Cover RL Associate shifts when understaffed.


7. Provide crisis intervention and one-on-one counseling to clients as needed.


8. Attend client interventions, case conferences and Multidisciplinary Team Meetings (MDT) as needed.


9. Coordinate clients’ sick calls.


10. Ensure clients attend Outside Appointments (OSAs) on time and that a person search is conducted upon their return; document findings appropriately.


11. Ensure that daily client count sheet is prepared by RL staff.


12. Schedule and supervise clients’ daily housekeeping tasks (GI’s) during assigned shifts.


13. Monitor and order all household supplies for the unit (3rd Shift responsibility).


14. Conduct multiple daily checks of clients’ rooms and all other rooms and areas on the unit to see that they are in order.


15. Report and investigate any issues and/or damages to the client’s rooms, classrooms and other common areas.


16. Notify kitchen in advance of all activities that require changing a mealtime or reduce the number of meals required.


17. Ensure that new clients are greeted and oriented appropriately by all RL Associates.


18. Wear RL Associate Staff t-shirt while on duty and ensure that all RL Associate staff members also wear staff t-shirts or polo shirt when on duty. Follow Dress Code Policy.


19. Document any BCAs/interventions/one-on-one sessions with clients.


20. Prepare Client Count Sheet, as assigned.


21. Ensure all family visits are conducted in a professional manner and adhere to applicable policies & procedures.


22. Ensure daily tasks are completed before the end of the shift.


23. Follow all Electronic Health Records (EHR) policies.


24. Complete the Detox and Naltrexone training within 60 days


25. Ensure all Paid Time Off (PTO) is requested 30 days prior via the Paylocity System.


26. In the Absence of the RL Supervisor Take on his/her responsibilities


**Qualifications:**


Associate degree with one (1) year of supervisory experience, 60 CADC Credits/Recovery Specialist or High School Diploma with five (5) years relevant experience working in the field of Addiction and Mental Health treatment. Have and maintain CPR/First Aid certification or achieve CPR/First Aid certification within thirty (30) days from the date of hire. Valid driver’s license from the state of residence and a clear driving record. Must have a clear Child Abuse Record Information (CARI). Good computer skills.


**Benefits:**


For full time positions, we offer medical, vision, dental, life and supplemental life insurance. Accidental and Critical Illness Insurance, 403B with employer match, Paid Time off (PTO), in house training seminars, two training days for certified professionals. SN also offers supervision for those individuals trying to become licensed in NJ as a LCADC/CADC, LSW, LCSW, LAC, LPC and LMFT. We participate in employee discount programs such as the Working Advantage program.

title: Quality Improvement Specialist #2
description:
**Who We Are:**


St. John’s Episcopal Hospital is the only hospital providing emergency and ambulatory care to the densely populated, culturally and economically diverse, and medically underserved populations of the Rockaways and Five Towns in southern Queens County and southwestern Nassau County, New York. Celebrating over 110 years of community care, the 257-bed facility provides people of all faiths with comprehensive preventive, diagnostic treatment and rehabilitative services, regardless of ability to pay.


***Come Grow With Us!***


**Type:** Full-Time


**Shift:** Days


**Hours:** 8:00AM – 4:30PM


**Pay:** $115,000 - $125,000


**Job Summary:**


The Quality Improvement Specialist will play a pivotal role in driving quality initiatives and enhancing patient safety at Episcopal Health Services. As part of the Office of Quality & Patient Safety, this position requires a highly motivated individual with a strong understanding of quality management principles and a passion for improving patient care and reducing harm.


**Responsibilities:**


* Coordinate and implement the organization's Quality Management, Patient Safety and Performance Improvement Programs.
* Recommend organizational objectives to enhance quality and patient safety, aligning with strategic priorities.
* Assess the quality of care in outpatient and inpatient settings and collaborate with multidisciplinary healthcare teams to enhance care delivery.
	+ Develop and implement quality improvement plans and strategies
	+ Conduct root cause analyses to identify and address quality issues
	+ Monitor and analyze quality metrics to track performance and identify areas for improvement
	+ Develop and implement quality control procedures and standards
	+ Facilitate quality improvement teams and workshops
	+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive continuous process improvement
* Participate in projects related to quality and patient safety, assisting in recommendations and coordinating implementation of corrective actions plans.
* Conduct clinical quality of care reviews, health outcomes reviews to ensure if standard of care was met.
* Prepare variance reports for leadership, physicians, and other team members as needed and present in interdisciplinary committees.
* Identify workflow barriers, patient-specific issues and concerns to appropriate leadership and improvement teams and department leaders and cross-functional teams for resolution.
* Provide expertise in TJC & CMS core measures, eCQMs, GWTG and indicators monitored by regulatory agencies, publicly reported quality reimbursement programs
* Monitors performances of all publicly reported and internal performance data to identify opportunities for improvement
* Conduct gap analysis on existing policies and practices and research best practices to make necessary recommendations
* Conduct focus studies to measure and assess patient care services' process stability and workflows for achievement of patient outcomes.
* Conduct education on quality management and performance improvement theoretical frameworks.
* Assist in developing appropriate measurements to assess processes and patient care outcomes.
* Collaborate with clinical and administrative leadership staff to ensure compliance with regulatory and professional standards.
* Review and evaluate the Performance Improvement Program and the Organizational Performance Improvement/Safety Plan as needed.


**Qualifications:**


* BSN nursing degree required. MSN Preferred
* Current New York State Registered Professional Nurse, Nurse Practitioner, or Physician Assistant license.
* Three to five years of clinical experience, including general knowledge of Quality Management principles, NYSDOH, CMS, and TJC Regulatory reporting requirements
* CPHQ and CPPS certifications preferred. If not, certification is required within six months of employment


**Additional Skills:**


* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools.
* Knowledge of Performance Improvement methodologies used within the organization.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams.
* Strong understanding of quality improvement principles and tools.

title: Program Director of Women's Residential Treatment Service
description:
**Are you passionate about making a difference in others' lives? Then come join the Straight and Narrow team!**

title: Junior Real Estate Analyst
description:
Come join The Halal Guys, the leader (and pioneer) of American Halal Food. Launched 30 years ago as a halal street cart on 53rd & 6th in New York City, our beloved and iconic fast casual brand now boasts 100 restaurants on three continents – with over 300 in development worldwide. In full growth mode, we have just launched a search for a Junior Real Estate Analyst to join our team at corporate headquarters in NYC.

  

Role of a Real Estate Analyst at The Halal Guys:* 1-3 years of experience with restaurant franchise models relating to Real Estate selection, site analysis and related responsibility.

  

• Understand the basics of restaurant franchise models relating to Real Estate processes • Create presentations using PowerPoint to present analysis on proposed site submittals by franchisees* Review documents like (Letter of Intent/Leases) to ensure it is following corporate standards

* Utilize Microsoft Office efficiently like (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, etc.)

* Understand and guide Franchisees through the site search and final lease execution

* Utilize Google Earth Pro to update and track territories relating to the internal franchisee base

* Analyze proposed new market areas for development and create presentations based on the analysis

* Understand the corporate site selection process thoroughly to conduct market visits with franchisees to share knowledge on finding optimal sites for development based on metrics utilized internally

* Coordinate and lead weekly calls with franchisees to track progress on the Real Estate site selection process

* Assist the Construction Department with any analysis relating to value engineering or any project relating modelling or further research analysis

* Work with the executive committee to complete adhoc projects relating to FDD and franchise documents in relation to internal datasets

* Constantly updating OneDrive Real Estate documents to ensure internal datasets are properly maintained and stored

* Utilize a project management tool like Franconnect to help franchisees understand the platform and properly use the platform to move the corporate process into this new tool

* Utilize a data analytical tool like Kalibrate to create reports and analysis on proposed territories and sites

* Create economic analysis reports for internal deals and adhoc requests

* Assist the Director with any current deals in doing analysis reports relating to real estate metrics or financial analysis as well as coordinating the deal progress to ensure proper delivery of proposals

* Work closely with Franchisees and develop effective time plans to stay on track per their development agreements

* Coordinate internal meetings

* Use Python to create basic scripts to help with any analytical processes or automate internal tasks

* Problem Solving: Understand the ask of the executive committee for adhoc projects and deliver solutions efficiently with proper analytical research

* Verbal Presentations: Concisely explain your analysis for a task and present it to the Director and Chief Development Officer for further feedback

  

Commute: Corporate office is relocating to Uniondale, NY, 11553 in October, and all applicants must have reliable commute.  

 Background: Construction Management, Real Estate Management, Project Management, Business Management, Real Estate development,  

Hospitality Management. Benefits: The Halal Guys believe our greatest asset are our employees, we offer competitive salaries and a full benefits package to include, Medical, Dental/Vision, PTO, and paid holidays.  

Job Type Full time (Not remote)  

Work Location: Corporate Office  

 Pay: $68,000 annual  

Please provide a resume **THE CORPORATE OFFICE WILL BE MOVING TO UNIONDALE LONG ISLAND IN OCTOBER OF 2024**.

title: Utility Assistant
description:
Celebrating 20 years since first opening its doors in London, Zuma is sophisticated twist on the traditional Japanese Izakaya style of informal eating and drinking. Co-founded by Rainer Becker and Arjun Waney in 2002, Zuma has 15 venues globally and 9 seasonal locations.  

  

Featuring modern Japanese cuisine that is authentic but not traditional. The menu showcases a variety of dishes from its three kitchens: the main kitchen, the sushi counter and the robata grill.  

  

Zuma, the brainchild of award-winning co-founder and creator, Rainer Becker, brings its internationally acclaimed style of authentic and modern Japanese food to Midtown, New York.

  

Zuma offers a comprehensive benefits package that reflects our commitment to taking great care of our team members. Here’s a summary of the fantastic benefits you can expect as part of the Zuma family:

* **Health Benefits:** Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance to ensure your well-being.
* **Paid Time Off:** Start with 10 days of PTO per year to relax and recharge.
* **Career Growth:** Take advantage of opportunities to grow your career with Zuma at our locations globally, including in the US, Europe, the Middle East, and Asia.
* **Global Experience:** Work alongside a team with extensive global hospitality and culinary experience, offering you invaluable learning and growth opportunities.
* **Family Meals:** Enjoy complimentary daily family meals at our restaurant.
* **Dining Discounts:** Receive a 50% discount on dining at Zuma, so you can savor our culinary delights even off the clock.
* **Referral Bonus Program:** Earn bonuses for referring talented friends and colleagues to join our team.

 **Essential Job Functions**


* Troubleshoots minor maintenance problems involving electrical, structural, plumbing, and equipment repair or replacement
* Performs preventative building maintenance duties
* Performs routine plumbing repairs such as unstopping toilets, sinks or urinals, fixing water leaks, and leaking faucets
* Performs routine electrical repairs such as changing light bulbs or fluorescent lamps and assists in repairing ballast and light fixtures
* Purchases supplies, equipment, and materials necessary to complete projects
* Assembles and moves furniture, hangs pictures and bulletin boards
* Repairs and replaces door knobs or locks, repairs door closures, patches holes in walls
* Paints interior and exterior walls
* Sets up and breaks down Private Event Space furniture
* Polishes leather furniture and walls
* Handles glassware
* Keeps storage rooms clean and organized
* Moves furniture to and from Staff Apartments
* Performs maintenance and repairs in Staff Apartments

title: Lead Teacher
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated Teacher to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience working with students and a passion for education, particularly in preschool and childcare settings. As a Teacher, you will play a crucial role in shaping young minds and fostering a positive learning environment.

**Duties**  
- Develop and implement engaging lesson plans  
- Provide individualized instruction to students  
- Manage classroom behavior effectively  
- Create a nurturing and supportive learning environment  
- Collaborate with colleagues to enhance the educational experience  
- Conduct assessments to monitor student progress  
- Support literacy education and child welfare initiatives

**Requirements**  
- Previous experience working with students, preferably in a preschool or childcare setting  
- Proficiency in behavior management techniques  
- Strong communication skills to effectively interact with students, parents, and colleagues  
- Ability to create and execute comprehensive lesson plans  
- Knowledge of tutoring methods to support student learning  
- Familiarity with classroom management strategies  
- Passion for promoting child welfare and development

**Responsibilities:**

* Designing and delivering lessons tailored to promote social, emotional, and cognitive development in infants and toddlers.
* Encouraging self-expression through empathy, adaptability, and positive reinforcement.
* Attending to the fundamental needs of infants with care and attention.
* Facilitating harmonious interactions and resolving conflicts with gentleness and understanding.
* Serving as a role model for young minds by exemplifying appropriate behavior at all times.
* Upholding a safe and inviting classroom environment conducive to exploration and learning.
* Providing regular updates on infants' progress to their families and caregivers.
* Actively participating in collaborative parent and staff meetings to foster meaningful partnerships.

**Requirements:**

* High School Diploma or Associate Degree (preferred).
* CPR certification and comprehensive training (preferred).
* Successful completion of a thorough background check and health examination.
* Previous experience in a preschool setting, particularly with infants and toddlers.
* Passion for working with babies and toddlers, coupled with patience, nurturing instincts, and thoughtfulness.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to maintain discretion regarding children's records.

Work Location: In person

If you're eager to embark on a rewarding career where you'll play a crucial role in the early development of infants and toddlers, apply now to join our team as an Infant Educator. Become a valued member of our dedicated community committed to providing the highest quality care and education to our littlest learners.

Schedule:

title: Office Manager
description:
**Office Manager - NYC Autism Charter Schools**

**Who Are We?**

NYC Autism Charter Schools are a pioneering network of two public charter schools in New York City, uniquely dedicated to serving children, teens, and young adults profoundly affected by autism. Founded by two passionate mothers, our schools provide an intensive, individualized education program (1:1 in most classrooms), ensuring each student receives the support they need to thrive. We also offer training and support for families, fostering a holistic approach to education and community involvement. If you are committed to making a difference in traditionally underserved and marginalized communities and seek a dynamic, positive work environment with ample growth opportunities, NYC Autism Charter Schools is the place for you. Join us in changing lives and creating new possibilities for our exceptional students.

**Role Overview:**

We seek an experienced and organized Office Manager to ensure smooth and efficient operation of our school’s main office. This role involves managing administrative tasks, coordinating office activities, supporting staff and students, and maintaining effective communication within the school community. The ideal candidate will have strong administrative skills, bi-lingual English and Spanish speaking, and a commitment to supporting our mission of serving students with autism.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Administration:** Oversee daily office operations, manage classroom and office supply inventory through audits, ordering, and restocking, and ensure the office functions smoothly.
* **Record Keeping:** Maintain accurate student attendance records, staff absences, and other essential documents. Ensure proper filing and documentation of all administrative paperwork.
* **Internal Communication:** Serve as the primary point of contact for internal communications, coordinating meetings, appointments, and events.
* **External Communication:** Handle incoming calls, emails, and correspondence and communication with parents, vendors, and external partners as needed.
* **Staff and Student Support:** Provide administrative support to staff, assist with scheduling professional development and appreciation activities, and coordinate transportation and health records for students.
* **Facilities Coordination:** Assist with coordination of maintenance and repair requests, ensuring the school environment is safe and clean.
* **Financial Administration:** Assist in managing the office budget, tracking expenditures, and preparing invoices and reimbursements.
* **Policy Implementation:** Ensure compliance with school policies and procedures, updating and communicating office policies as necessary.
* **Event Coordination:** Plan and coordinate school events, meetings, and functions, managing all logistical aspects efficiently.

**Qualifications and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or a related field.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in office management or a similar administrative role, preferably in an educational or nonprofit setting.
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and office management software.
* Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality and professionalism.
* Spanish speaker required.

**Why Should You Join Us?**

* **Impact:** Make a significant impact on the lives of students with autism and their families.
* **Growth:** Be part of a positive, can-do work environment with professional growth and learning opportunities.
* **Community:** Work in a supportive and collaborative community dedicated to improving educational outcomes for underserved populations.
* **Innovation:** Join a pioneering organization leading the way in autism education.

**Benefits**

· Annual performance-based bonus up to $5,000.

· Tuition Reimbursement.

· Employer paid medical, disability and life insurance.

· Accrue up to 17 sick and vacation days in your first year with annual increases.

· Additional benefits include 401k matching, commuter benefits, and employee wellness programs.

**Salary Range:**

Starting salary of $50,000-$60,000 based upon experience.

**To apply:**

When submitting your application, please include a cover letter and list three references.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Office/Administrative: 2 years (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Summer Law Clerk
description:
**About LEE**


LEE is a diverse, nonpartisan network of equity-minded leaders at all stages of life and career. We provide 1:1 coaching, meaningful member-to-member connections, and skill-building opportunities to support and inspire members to increase equity everywhere.


LEE is a civic leadership development membership organization currently open to alumni of our partner organizations including Teach For America, Congressional Hispanic Caucus Institute (CHCI), New Leaders, Latinos for Education, City Teaching Alliance, School Board Partners, Public Allies, and more.


We equip LEE members with the tools, resources, and industry knowledge they need to take collective action and create change in their communities – whether that’s through policymaking, elected leadership, advocacy, or grassroots organizing.


**LEE believes that when a diverse group of leaders, grounded in a commitment to equity, are in leadership roles, they can be a transformative force for and with students and communities.**


We are an outcomes-oriented organization that operates in an entrepreneurial environment deeply invested in continuous improvement. LEE is honored to have been selected as a LATINA Style 50 Award recipient and a When Work Works award recipient. We are also an Employer of National Service. If you would like to become part of our team and join the fight for educational equity, or if you would simply like to learn more, please visit wearelee.org.


**Position Summary**:


The Law Clerk reports to and will work closely with LEE’s General Counsel. The General Counsel manages the organization’s risk and compliance and provides legal and strategic advice to the Executive Director, the leadership team, and to LEE’s staff across all program and operations teams. The General Counsel practices in a wide range of substantive areas including employment law, tax-exempt organization law, compliance, and campaign finance laws. Day-to-day work often includes: advising staff on how to navigate legal as well as policy questions, drafting high-level communications for staff, developing and analyzing systems and processes for compliance, drafting and reviewing contracts, and supporting the organization’s board of directors.  

  

The Law Clerk is a paid position. The position is a full-time, temporary position for up to 40 hours per week from starting around May 15th through on or around July 31st, 2025.


**Position Location:** New York City (hybrid–3 days/week in office)


**Travel Requirements:** 0%


**Responsibilities:**

Learning and Research (100%)


* Learn about the practice of law as an in-house counsel in a non-profit organization setting
* Develop an understanding of the issues faced by 501(c)(4) and 501(c)(3) non-profits
* Practice legal skills such as legal research, legal writing, and drafting client communications
* Conduct legal research across a wide variety of substantive areas with a particular focus on corporate law, contracts, employment law, and tax-exempt organization law with an opportunity to create a writing sample
* Producing high-quality written communication for different constituencies within the organization
* Other responsibilities, as assigned

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree or commensurate years of work experience (If you do not hold a Bachelor’s degree an additional 4 years of relevant experience is required. If you hold an Associate’s degree an additional 2 years of relevant experience is required.)
* Enrolled in law school and actively pursuing a J.D. with at least 1 year of law school complete
* 3.2 GPA or above in law school
* Strong, demonstrated commitment to diversity, equity, & inclusion
* Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate within a geographically dispersed team
* Deep passion for educational equity and belief in LEE’s mission and theory of change

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, impact-focused environment
* Discretion, ownership, and initiative to independently drive projects forward
* Commitment to educational equity
* Strong written and interpersonal communication skills
* Strong research skills
* Knowledge of Microsoft Word
* Access to Lexis/Nexis or Westlaw

**Physical Requirements & Work Demands:**


* This position is primarily a sedentary role working with colleagues based around the country using remote technologies.
* The person in this position may need to occasionally move about inside the office to liaise with staff or access office equipment.

**Application Submission:**


Thank you for considering LEE as a future employer, we are eager to review your application and learn more about your experiences and interest in LEE's mission. We encourage you to submit your application at your earliest convenience. However, we do not have an application deadline for this position and we will review applications on a rolling basis. For additional information, please visit the Frequently Asked Questions section on **LEE's Careers website****:** **https://wearelee.org/who-we-are/careers/**.


**Pay and Benefits**

The position level for this role is Director 1 and the corresponding hourly pay range for this position is $46.15-$57.92. Pay is competitive and based upon relevant experience and cost of labor for your location. Learn more about compensation here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kUbPtNQiPIjWA4xbEaEY08RLQ-ZeO49wd8dc1v3U\\_s8/edit?usp=sharing.


Please visit LEE's Careers Website for information on benefits that full-time temporary staff have access to:


* Full-time Temporary: https://wearelee.org/who-we-are/careers/#:~:text=Time%20Temporary%20Staff-,Care%20For%20Your%20Health,-Medical%2C%20dental%2C%20and


**An Equal-Opportunity Employer with a Commitment to Diversity**


Leadership for Educational Equity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and as an organization committed to diversity, and the perspective of all voices, we consider applicants equally of race, gender, age, color, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, disability, political affiliation, and national origin. We reasonably accommodate staff members and/or applicants with disabilities, provided they are otherwise able to perform the essential functions of the job.


An affirmative action-equal opportunity employer.

title: Planner IIl
description:
**Job Description**

Responsible for planning, scheduling, releasing and tracking of the workflow from engineering through manufacturing and shipping. This individual will work as a prime interface with our Program Managers, Procurement, Engineering and Quality departments to maintain the flow of material through the system. In addition, expedite parts and services in conjunction with the Program Buyer. Planner will also perform the following tasks: Maintain the schedule for each contract in MRP (Infor XA); create, track, and report on their assigned contract(s); flow down all engineering changes to appropriate departments and is responsible to maintain and analyze standard verses budgeted manpower hours; achieve positive results while adhering to CPI values and processes.

**Essential Functions:**

Coordinate with Program manager and production to sequence manufacturing, assembly, and finalization  
Participate in all IPT and daily stand up meetings  
Maintain lead-times and due dates on all assemblies as needed during the build process  
Plan production tasks and schedules to ensure customer orders meet on time delivery  
Flow down all engineering changes  
Create and maintain line of balance (LOB) for all production programs  
Coordinate with all departments and Program manager as needed to identify and resolve issues regarding delivery and budget  
Manage work order demands through MRP  
Ensure PVD (primary visual board) is maintained and monitored on a daily basis  
Perform capacity planning analysis  
Assist with new program introduction phase

**Qualifications**  
3+ years of experience  
Bachelor’s Degree preferred or equivalent education and work experience  
Strong organizational, analytical and communication skills required  
Proficient in Microsoft Excel  
Experience in MRP/ERP system is required

***CPI Aero considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.***

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Condé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company’s portfolio includes many of the world’s most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others.
Job Description
Location:
New York, NY
Condé Nast is seeking an Executive Assistant to the Senior Vice President, Content.  

Based out of our New York City office, qualified candidates must have exemplary, detailed-oriented organizational skills, as well as excellent communication and writing abilities. Candidates must have the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced global environment, experience handling complex and ever-changing schedules, and a high degree of personal responsibility. An understanding of the media and entertainment industries is a bonus.  

This is a real opportunity to be a part of building modern, effective business functions in partnership with other new and existing teams whilst still benefiting from the already existing world-class brands and global scale, reach and reputation of one of the world’s foremost media and entertainment companies. The ideal candidate will welcome the opportunity to be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial organization and will thrive in a multi-faceted business with a global focus.  

Primary Responsibilities:* Manage, schedule and coordinate meetings including multi-party, multi-time zone, video, and conference calls
* Manage ever-changing calendars in Google Calendar with the ability to update, cancel and confirm meetings
* Scheduling and coordinating meetings both in-office and offsite.
* Arrange travel - including global travel
* Prepare expense reports for review & submit to accounting for approval
* Liaise and partner with other teams within the company as needed
* Liaise with entertainment industry partners as needed
* Assist with organizational and business functions of the department as needed, including drafting correspondence, drafting memos, drafting presentation decks, tracking precedent, project milestones and/or communications, and creating forms and organizational systems
* Assist with planning social events and company events and managing employee morale

  

Desired Skills and Qualifications:* 2+ years of administrative experience within a fast-paced environment
* Bachelor’s degree
* Ability to liaise with key senior-level executives
* Ability to liaise with internal staff at all levels and external clients & partners
* Ability to work with in a multi-time zone environment
* Highly professional with excellent judgement
* Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal
* Experience with Google Suite (Docs, Sheets and Slides)
* Extremely proactive approach, reputation as a doer
* Ability to work under pressure and in a fast-paced environment
* Positive, self-motivated attitude
* Critical attention to detail and highly organized
* Strong analytical capabilities and judgement in order to identify and implement effective solutions while under time pressure

  

Preferred/Helpful Skills and Qualifications:* Familiarity with the brands and businesses of Condé Nast
* Salary Range: $70,000-$90,000


What happens next?
If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply below, and we will review your application as soon as possible. You can update your resume or upload a cover letter at any time by accessing your candidate profile.*Condé Nast is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.*

description:
**MUST HAVE 1 YEAR OF RAYMOND REACH TRUCK EXP**

Operates electric forklift, which requires moving levers and pressing pedals to drive truck and control movement of lifting apparatus in the cooler, freezer, and dry spaces; unloads/loads pallets of products using pallet jacks and forklifts; stores and removes pallets of products from rack locations; puts product in overflow locations; hand stacks product onto/off of pallets and into packing locations as required; maintains a clean work environment by performing duties of sweeping, ice removal, scrubbing with rags and brushes, and removing trash as required; transfers any leftover items to the Home slot and cleans up aisles and picks up leftover pallets at the end of the shift; performs duties of order selector as needed. Basic requirements include one year of warehouse distribution experience and Pallet Jack and Forklift Certification from Sysco. Reports to Inbound or Outbound Warehouse Supervisor.

title: Care Manager
description:
Position Summary

Assures the delivery of quality services in accordance with established hospital, departmental and regulatory/accreditation agency standards.

Is responsible and accountable for the overall operations of their assigned department, in conjunction with UM manager and the department Director. Overall operations of the department including quality assurance and PI plan, development of department goals and objectives that are consistent with the hospital mission, the management of personnel, preparing/monitoring of and accountability for the department budgets.

Assures employee compliance with hospital, nursing department and Human Resources policies and procedures

Assures that employee orientation, skill competency and continuing education requirements, are satisfied, as per regulatory requirements –government, state, hospital and department policies/regulations.

Participates in the hospital Performance Improvement Program, as defined by the organization, and sets up department PI plan based on regulatory requirement, as needed. Follows up on outliers and areas identified as needed improvement.

Is responsible for participation on committees, task forces and projects as appropriate and required.

Assures the provision of a safe employee/patient environment and follows up on all staff incidents and safety issues. Maintains knowledge and continuing education related to the operations and needs of the department.

Works collaboratively with all levels of the hospital interdisciplinary team and promotes the team concepts, effective communication and cooperative spirit, within the department and hospital wide departments.

Demonstrates positive customer service skills, fosters positive employee relations and assures staff adherence to the Customer Service Behavioral Standards.

Is supportive of hospital initiatives and projects and functions. Serves as a role model and a positive change agent.

Promotes a positive and professional image and behaviors. Serves as a coach and mentor and provides necessary resources to staff, peers and patients as needed.

Establishes and maintains good working relationships with community agencies and facilities. Develops ways of getting monthly information from them re stats and outcomes, to ensure our patients are receiving the best possible care after transition and discharge.

Has a working knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid guidelines and regulatory requirements/parameters, to ensure compliance. Has an understanding of HMOs operations and other private health insurances.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities Includes the Following:

* Understands and adheres to the Performance Standards, Policies and Behaviors
* Develops and submits departmental goals and objectives as required by the Division Administrator on an annual basis.
* Interviews, recommends hires, evaluates, counsels and recommends terminations of employees, as per hospital policy and departmental needs.
* Schedules staff based on budgeted staffing plan and hospital needs, ensuring adequate coverage, for a safe patient care, to prevent delays in discharge.
* Develops and submits operating and capital budgets and reports variances on a monthly basis, as required by the department director.
* Assures compliance with state regulations and accreditation standards.
* Assures completion of staff orientation, annual and ongoing competency and education requirements. Summarizes monthly PI studies done by the staff and recommends actions for improvement.
* Attends and participates in continuing education programs and other related activities, to maintain current level of skills and expertise to manage the department, in conjunction with the UM manager and department director.
* Participates and assures department involvement in ongoing Performance Improvement initiative. Submits monthly reports as required.
* Attends Management/Leadership meetings as required.
* Conducts staff meetings, in the absence of the director, to update staff and/or address department issues and ensures meeting minutes are being taken and kept for all staff and future reference.
* Utilizes multiple methodologies to communicate information, ensuring follow up and understanding of all levels of staff members.
* Adheres to safety standards for employees and patients.
* Participates in committees, task forces, projects, etc. as required.
* Performs all other related duties as assigned

Education & Experience Requirements

* Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing with RN License required, Master’s Degree in Nursing preferred
* 5 years managerial experience within the acute hospital
* Previous experience as a case manager required
* Knowledge of healthcare financial, regulatory and payer issue setting required
* Knowledge of state, local and federal programs required
* Experience with Millimen/Interqual criteria required
* PRI/Screen certification preferred
* C.C.M. certification preferred
* Computer skills required

Core Competencies

Demonstrates ability to establish two-way communication, by clearly defining expectations, and functions, based on regulatory requirements and hospital policies.

Communicating with the staff, utilizing a variety of methods, and actively listening to ideas and concerns and responding in an appropriate manner.

Demonstrates ability to delegate responsibilities appropriately. Demonstrates ability to retain composure under stress.

Escalates issues to the director, as soon as they occur, to come up with joint resolutions, for safe care and interventions.

title: Business Analyst - 5447387
description:
**Accenture Flex** offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.


As an **Accenture Flex** employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.


You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. **Accenture Flex** employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.


Key Responsibilities:

* As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing the organization and designing its processes and systems. This includes assessing the business model and its integration with technology, as well as researching, gathering, and synthesizing information.
* Focuses on owning and driving discussion / workstream with business and other stakeholders.
* Bridge the gap between business requirements and technical delivery team.
* Assist Product Owners with the development and documentation of Epics and Stories.
* Define business process and data flows.
* Assess the scope and impact of system, dependencies and process changes.
* Progress projects to completion in a complex workspace.
* Leverage core technical platform to deliver business functionality.
* Facilitate design sessions with technology teams.
* Design of test strategies including preparing test cases and test plans.
* Work closely with business and technology teams to gather testing requirements.
* Escalation of issues in a timely manner.
* Produce system and process documentation.
* Ensure adherence to audit and operation standards.

  

Basic Qualifications:

* 3 years of Business Analyst Experience
* 3 years of Excellent technical skills in SQL,
* 3 Years of Good Experience in Excel, VBA
* High School Diploma or GED


Preferred Qualifications:

* Strong Market Risk, Risk or Front Office experience
* Strong financial products knowledge
* Solid understanding of regulatory landscape
* Excellent analytical and quantitative skills
* Strong problem solving skills and experience in analyzing large volumes of financial data
* Ability to effectively communicate within a multi disciplined team and demanding business users
* Good organization skills with efficient follow ups driving conclusions
* Experience with SDLC and agile methodologies

title: Agile Scrum Master - 5476022
description:
**Accenture Flex** offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.


As an **Accenture Flex** employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.


You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. **Accenture Flex** employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

**THE WORK**


As a Scrum Master, you will act as an enabler for the effective functioning of a software development team using Agile methodologies.

* Your responsibilities will include coaching and mentoring the Scrum Team(s), removing barriers to successful implementation, and facilitating scrum and agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
* You will also be responsible for identifying and reporting progress via appropriate metrics. In addition, you are expected to be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) with deep knowledge in Scrum and Agile Project Management.
* You will act in an advisory role in meetings and be the primary contact (go-to person) for Scrum and Agile Project Management.
* You will also be expected to publish on your area of expertise within and outside of Accenture, present at conferences, and provide solutions to business areas and Accenture-wide problems.
* Furthermore, you will contribute to and be held directly and indirectly responsible for business area decisions, define business area goals, and may be held directly or indirectly responsible for organizational-level decisions.
* Advanced proficiency in Scrum and Agile Project Management is required. Advanced proficiency in Agile Process Coaching, Agile Methods (ADM for Distributed Agile Development), and Agile Scrum Project Management are recommended.
* Lead and facilitate Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills
* Coach and mentor the Scrum Team(s) to ensure effective implementation of Agile methodologies
* Identify and remove barriers to successful implementation of Agile methodologies
* Report progress and metrics to stakeholders
* Continuously improve Agile processes and practices
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills

  

**Here's What You Need:**

* Minimum 5 years of experience as a Scrum Master or in a similar Agile role
* Certified Scrum Master CSM or similar certification
* High School Diploma or GED
* Minimum 5 years of experience in the Scrum Management activities like Scrum principles, practices and values
* Excellent facilitation, coaching, and communication skills
* Ability to remove impediments and navigate conflicts
* Minimum 5 years of experience with Agile project management tools such as JIRA is a must

**Bonus Points, if:**

* Experience with scaled Agile frameworks
* Knowledge of Kanban principles and practices is preferable
* Experience with coaching distributed teams is preferable

title: Mechanical Project Manager
description:
**Mechanical Project Manager**

**Full job description**

**POSITION SUMMARY:** This position requires a skilled multi-tasker, working with various teams to manage assigned project scopes. Candidate should possess a strong work ethic, a collaborative team mindset but capable of independently estimating change orders and successfully managing all aspects of multiple projects, simultaneously, from kickoff through closeout completion.

**DUTY SUMMARY:** Work effectively in a fast-paced environment with the construction, automation, and service teams, executing all tasks required from initial kickoff meeting to final project completion while within budget and deadline.

**REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS:**

* 3+ years construction/HVAC experience in project management and/or estimating required
* An outgoing personality with strong communication and negotiation skills
* Initiative; self-motivated and driven self-starter with high integrity.
* Skillful listener, with excellent communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills.
* Excellent time management skills and prioritization of tasks to meet deadlines and work on multiple project tasks simultaneously
* Knowledge in Public Bids a plus
* Ability to work on several projects simultaneously
* Analytical thinking with strong attention to detail
* Proficient with Microsoft Office and Sharepoint: Outlook/Word/Excel/Teams
* High School diploma/GED or higher education and a quick learner
* Must be punctual, dependable and be able to take initiative and be proactive
* Embrace change in processes as the company continues to grow
* Current valid driver’s license for operating motor vehicles in the state of New Jersey
* Must remain vigilant in staying current with market trends, costs and competition, in order to remain competitive,

**DUTIES & RESPONSIBLITITES:**

* Work directly with internal teams and clients to determine project scope, specifications, requirements and establish deadlines
* Ensure that the estimating and turnover standards are utilized effectively and recommend updates in processes when available.
* Run execution of the project in accordance with organization's project management methodology according to the established project plan
* Coordinate with vendors to ensure they are integrated into the project and that the customer receives products on time and satisfactory standards of service
* Develop and build internal and external relationships by promptly addressing concerns and resolving
* Oversee and communicate progression to all stakeholders involved with the account/customer throughout process including:

· **Design**

**· Permitting**

**· Material delivery**

**· Labor scheduling**

**· Field installation**

**· Forecasting & financial reporting**

* Participate in weekly Work in progress (WIP) meetings with internal teams to reinforce status.
* Supervise progress and performance against the project plan; take action to resolve problems, minimize delays and follow-up on all aspects of projects
* Complete deliverables within or below budgeted guidelines, advising stakeholders with enough notice to pivot or remedy any challenges or anticipated financial ramifications.
* Ensure compliance with OSHA & safety program for employees and subcontractors.
* Perform job site visits to ensure quality control
* Manage project file structures in hardcopy and digital formats and work with supporting coordinator for timely invoicing of work, complete RFIs, submittals, change orders and warranty statements/O&Ms as needed

**Working Conditions:** Position is 50% office and 50% field, candidate should have the ability to climb ladders/stairs to view system components, maneuvering in mechanical rooms, and similar, when the need arises to visit project locations

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by people assigned this job. They are not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills and abilities associated with the job.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $103,548.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Experience:

* construction/HVAC in project management: 3 years (Required)
* Construction estimating: 3 years (Required)
* Public Bids: 1 year (Required)
* Design/Permitting/Material delivery/Labor scheduling: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Administrative Assistant – Healthcare exp req’d
description:
**Administrative Assistant –** Healthcare exp req’d

**Full-Time**

**THE BEST CAREERS.** RIGHT HERE

@ BROOKLYN’S LEADING HEALTHCARE SYSTEM**.**

**MAIMONIDES: TOP TEN IN THE U.S. FOR CLINICAL OUTCOMES**

We’re Maimonides Health, Brooklyn’s largest healthcare system, serving over 250,000 patients each year through the system’s 3 hospitals, 1800 physicians and healthcare professionals, more than 80 community-based practices and outpatient centers*. At Maimonides Health, our core values* ***H.E.A.R.T*** *drives everything we do. We uphold and maintain Honesty, Empathy, Accountability, Respect, and Teamwork to empower our talented team, engage our respective communities and provide patient-centered care.* The system is anchored by Maimonides Medical Center, one of the nation’s largest independent teaching hospitals and home to centers of excellence in numerous specialties; Maimonides Midwood Community Hospital (formerly New York Community Hospital), a 130-bed adult medical-surgical hospital; and Maimonides Children’s Hospital, Brooklyn’s only children’s hospital and only pediatric trauma center. Maimonides’ clinical programs rank among the best in the country for patient outcomes, including its Heart and Vascular Institute, Neurosciences Institute, Bone and Joint Center, and Cancer Center. Maimonides is an affiliate of Northwell Health and a major clinical training site for SUNY Downstate College of Medicine.

We currently have an excellent full-time opportunity for an experienced **Administrative Assistant** who can multi-task in a deadline-driven environment and support our CHRO in the Human Resources Department.

**In addition, you will:**

* Perform varied and complex typing tasks, including typing all confidential material. Maintains strict confidentiality of sensitive material and information. Complete all typing assignments accurately; regularly proof final copies to ensure they are letter-perfect and in an attractive and easy-to-read format.
* Compose routine correspondence for division.
* Schedule meetings and appointments. Maintain and update supervisor's daily calendar; as appropriate, schedule patient appointments for physicians; ensure smooth flow of patients through the office.
* Arrange meetings and conferences (e.g. schedule speakers and arrange to have them paid, book rooms, make catering arrangements).
* Take and transcribe minutes at departmental and other meetings as required.
* Open and route incoming mail; Distribute correspondence and other materials to department staff.
* Answer telephones, route callers, take messages and provide routine information to callers; communicate effectively with personnel and other departments as necessary.
* Maintain employee attendance records (including vacation time, and sick days); process time cards and sign-in sheets for department employees.
* Maintain adequate inventory of supplies in the office, reordering as necessary and distributing supplies to appropriate areas of the department.
* Prepare all purchase orders and check requests to purchase merchandise and office supplies as needed; receive merchandise and check items against original requisition for accuracy; prepare check requests to pay vendors and maintain department records.
* Set up and maintain a departmental filing system and patient record files.
* Maintain established departmental policies and procedures, objectives, quality assurance program, safety, environmental, and infection control standards.
* Thoroughly research subject matter for a variety of administrative reports, statements and rosters; information included is accurate and relevant to the topic and is gathered on a timely basis; meet deadlines.
* Maintain required databases and spreadsheets; enter data accurately and in a timely manner and produce required reports as required.

**We require:**

* **High School graduation or equivalent;** **1-2 years of college preferred**
* **2-3 years of executive/secretarial experience**
* **Medical Terminology**
* **Shorthand, fast longhand or ability to transcribe from Dictaphone**
* **MS Office proficiency**
* **Good interpersonal and English verbal/written communication skills**

**Salary: $55,000-$62,000/year with excellent** **benefits** including 403 (b) retirement plan. Administrative Assistant, for immediate consideration, please email to **resumes@maimo.org**.

Maimonides Medical Center (MMC) is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard for race, creed (religion), color, sex, national origin, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, age, disability, pregnancy, predisposing genetic characteristic, marital status or domestic violence victim status, citizenship status, or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. MMC is committed to following the requirements of the New York State Human Rights Law with regard to non-discrimination on the basis of prior criminal conviction and prior arrest.
